keyword: calories in one stick of butter
title: Calories in One Stick of Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in one stick of butter, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, sodium, and equivalents, plus tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in One Stick of Butter
assumptions: Standard US stick (113 g or 4 oz), unsalted, conventional dairy butter at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, salting, and whether organic or cultured; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One stick of unsalted butter provides about 810 calories, nearly all from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 calories for a standard 113 g unsalted stick.

faqs.q: Is one stick of butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 58 g of saturated fat per stick, which is over the daily recommended limit for many diets.

faqs.q: How much fat is in one stick of butter?
faqs.a: Roughly 92 g total fat, with minimal carbs or protein.

faqs.q: Does salted vs. unsalted butter change calories?
faqs.a: No, calories remain the same (~810), but sodium increases to ~600-800 mg in salted.

faqs.q: What are calories per tablespoon of butter?
faqs.a: About 102 kcal per tablespoon (1/16 of a stick), since one stick is 16 tablespoons.
